workflow.name: Automate Telegram channel post reactions with bot rotation & GPT-5-mini
workflow.description:
## üìã WORKFLOW OVERVIEW

**Automate reactions for Telegram Channel Posts** - Automated Telegram reaction system for specific posts
##
**Flow:**

1. User sends message to a receiver bot
2. AI parses request (emoji type & quantity)
3. Code processes and validates data
4. Loop sends reactions one by one
5. User receives confirmation

##
**Key Features:**
- Natural language processing by sending a message to a chat bot to react to a post on a different channel
- Reiterates through bot token rotation. This means that if you use 100 bots then you will be able to have 100 reactions per post of your choice
- Rate limit protection
- Error handling with helpful messages
##
You will need to first add the bots that you personally own which can be acquired from BotFather to the channel that you would want them to react posts to and allow it to manage messages.
##
Required Bot Permissions:
1. Bot Must Be an Administrator
The bot needs to be added as an admin to the channel (regular member status won't work for reactions).
2. Specific Admin Rights Needed:
When adding the bot as admin, you need to enable:
‚úÖ "Post Messages" - This is actually the key permission needed
‚úÖ "Add Subscribers" (optional, but sometimes required depending on channel settings)
##
Credentials needed are:
Target Channel ID, Bot tokens, Bot Receiver token, OpenAI API
##
**Example Usage:**
- "https://t.me/channel/123 needs 10 hearts and 10 fire reactions

##
If in need of help contact me at:
elijahmamuri@gmail.com

workflow.name: Automate reactions for Telegram Channel Posts using bots

parameters.content:
## üì± Telegram Trigger

**Purpose:** Entry point for the workflow

**What it does:**
- Listens for incoming Telegram messages
- Captures user requests like:
  - "Give me 5 fire reactions"
  - "https://t.me/channel/123 needs 10 reactions"

**Outputs:** Message object with text, chat ID, and user info

## ü§ñ AI Analysis

**Purpose:** Intelligently parse user requests

**What it does:**
- Analyzes the user's message
- Extracts:
  - Number of reactions requested
  - Specific emoji types (fire, heart, thumbs up, etc.)
  - Handles natural language ("5 fire" ‚Üí ["üî•","üî•","üî•","üî•","üî•"])

**AI Model:** GPT-5-MINI

**Output:** JSON array of emojis based on request

## üîß Data Processing

**Purpose:** Transform AI output into API-ready format

**What it does:**
1. Extracts message ID from Telegram link
2. Validates emojis against Telegram's allowed list
3. Handles duplicates intelligently:
   - Allows duplicates if ‚â§3 unique emojis requested
   - Replaces invalid emojis with random valid ones
4. Assigns bot tokens (rotates through n number of your bots based on the tokens that you provide)
5. Creates array of reaction objects

**Output Format:**
```json
{
  "emoji": "üî•",
  "botToken": "...",
  "chatId": "-1003154563293",
  "messageId": 123
}
```
NOTE:
Replace lines 15 and 33 of the code prep node with your own channel ID and Bot tokens

## üîç Debug Logger

**Purpose:** Monitoring and troubleshooting

**What it does:**
- Logs total items being processed
- Shows each reaction's details:
  - Emoji being sent
  - Target chat/message IDs
  - Bot token (partially hidden)

**Useful for:** Debugging failed reactions

## üîÑ Batch Processor

**Purpose:** Send reactions one at a time

**What it does:**
- Takes array of reaction objects
- Loops through each item
- Sends one reaction per iteration
- Prevents rate limiting by processing sequentially

**Why needed:** Telegram API requires individual requests per reaction

## üöÄ Send Reaction

**Purpose:** Execute Telegram API call

**What it does:**
- Calls Telegram's `setMessageReaction` endpoint
- Sends:
  - Bot token (for authentication)
  - Chat ID (target channel)
  - Message ID (specific post)
  - Emoji (reaction to add)

**API Endpoint:**
`https://api.telegram.org/bot{token}/setMessageReaction`

**Result:** Reaction appears on the message

## ‚è±Ô∏è Rate Limiting

**Purpose:** Prevent API throttling

**What it does:**
- Limits execution rate
- Adds wait time between batches
- Ensures workflow doesn't hit Telegram's rate limits

**Components:**
1. **Limit Node** - Controls flow rate
2. **Wait Node** - Adds delay between operations

## ‚úÖ Completion

**Purpose:** User confirmation

**What it does:**
- Sends "All done!" message back to user
- Confirms all reactions were added
- Uses original chat ID from trigger

**User Experience:** User gets immediate feedback that their request completed successfully

## üìã WORKFLOW OVERVIEW

**Telegram Multiple Reactions Army Bot** - Automated Telegram reaction system

**Flow:**
1. User sends message to bot
2. AI parses request (emoji type & quantity)
3. Code processes and validates data
4. Loop sends reactions one by one
5. User receives confirmation

**Key Features:**
- Natural language processing
- Reiterates through bot token rotation
- Duplicate emoji handling
- Rate limit protection
- Error handling with helpful messages

1st add the bots to the channel that you would want them to react posts to and allow it to manage messages

Credentials needed are:
Target Channel ID, Bot tokens, Bot Receiver token

**Example Usage:**
- "https://t.me/channel/123 needs 10 hearts and 10 fire reactions


PS: To get the ID of a channel in TG

There are a few ways to find the chat/channel ID of a Telegram channel (public or private). Here are common methods:

‚úÖ Method 1: Use a bot
1. Add a bot like @userinfobot or @getmy_idbot to your channel (or forward a message from the channel to the bot).
2. The bot will reply with the channel‚Äôs numeric ID (for example: -1001234567890) for private channels.
3. Make sure forwarding is allowed if the channel blocks forwarding.

values.content:
=You are a Telegram Reaction Army AI assistant. Your job is to analyze incoming Telegram messages and extract reaction requests.

The user will provide:
1. A Telegram message link (e.g., https://t.me/channelname/123)
2. The number and type of reactions they want

TASK:
1. Read the user's message carefully
2. Extract the NUMBER of reactions requested
3. Check if the user specified PARTICULAR emojis or types
4. Generate the exact emojis based on their request

AVAILABLE EMOJIS:
üëç, üëé, ‚ù§Ô∏è, üî•, ü•∞, üëè, üòÅ, ü§î, ü§Ø, üò±, ü§¨, üò¢, üéâ, ü§©, ü§Æ, üí©, üôè, üëå, üïä, ü§°, ü•±, ü•¥, üòç, üê≥, ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•, üåö, üå≠, üíØ, ü§£, ‚ö°Ô∏è, üçå, üèÜ, üíî, ü§®, üòê, üçì, üçæ, üíã, üñï, üòà, üò¥, üò≠, ü§ì, üëª, üë®‚Äçüíª, üëÄ, üéÉ, üôà, üòá, üò®, ü§ù, ‚úçÔ∏è, ü§ó, ü´°, üéÖ, üéÑ, ‚òÉÔ∏è, üíÖ, ü§™, üóø, üÜí, üíò, üôâ, ü¶Ñ, üòò, üíä, üôä, üòé, üëæ, ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è, ü§∑, ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è, üò°

EMOJI ALIASES (understand these as the emojis):
- "fire" = üî•
- "heart" or "love" = ‚ù§Ô∏è
- "thumbs up" or "like" = üëç
- "party" or "celebrate" = üéâ
- "clap" or "applause" = üëè
- "thinking" = ü§î
- "crying" or "sad" = üò¢
- "100" or "hundred" = üíØ
- "rocket" or "lightning" = ‚ö°Ô∏è
- "trophy" or "winner" = üèÜ
- "pray" or "please" = üôè
- "poop" or "shit" = üí©
- "angry" or "mad" = üò°
- "cool" or "sunglasses" = üòé
- "shocked" or "mind blown" = ü§Ø
- "laugh" or "laughing" = ü§£

SPECIFIC REQUEST HANDLING:
- If user requests specific emojis (e.g., "5 fire emojis", "give me 3 hearts"), use ONLY that emoji repeated
- If user mentions multiple specific emojis (e.g., "2 fire and 3 hearts"), give exactly what they asked
- If user says "random" or doesn't specify, give random different emojis
- If the requested emoji is not in the available list, use the closest match or random emojis

OUTPUT FORMAT (CRITICAL):
You MUST respond with ONLY a valid JSON array of emoji strings. Nothing else.

Example inputs and outputs:

Input: "hey reaction army AI i need 5 reactions for my most recent post"
Output: ["üî•", "‚ù§Ô∏è", "üòÇ", "üëç", "üéâ"]

Input: "give me 5 fire emojis"
Output: ["üî•", "üî•", "üî•", "üî•", "üî•"]

Input: "please give me 3 hearts and 2 fire"
Output: ["‚ù§Ô∏è", "‚ù§Ô∏è", "‚ù§Ô∏è", "üî•", "üî•"]

Input: "i need 7 thumbs up reactions"
Output: ["üëç", "üëç", "üëç", "üëç", "üëç", "üëç", "üëç"]

Input: "reaction army! give me 4 party emojis and 2 claps"
Output: ["üéâ", "üéâ", "üéâ", "üéâ", "üëè", "üëè"]

Input: "10 random reactions please"
Output: ["üî•", "‚ù§Ô∏è", "üòé", "üèÜ", "üíØ", "ü§Ø", "üëç", "üéâ", "üòÅ", "‚ö°Ô∏è"]

Input: "5 fire and 5 hearts"
Output: ["üî•", "üî•", "üî•", "üî•", "üî•", "‚ù§Ô∏è", "‚ù§Ô∏è", "‚ù§Ô∏è", "‚ù§Ô∏è", "‚ù§Ô∏è"]

RULES:
- Always output valid JSON array format
- Each emoji must be a separate string in the array
- For specific emoji requests, repeat the SAME emoji the requested number of times
- For mixed requests, follow the exact quantities specified
- Randomly select emojis ONLY when user doesn't specify which ones
- If the number cannot be determined, default to 5 reactions
- Output ONLY the JSON array, no explanations or additional text
- When repeating emojis, it's OK to have duplicates if that's what the user requested

user.name: Cj Elijah Garay
user.bio: I build custom AI agents for individuals and startups looking to automate their workflows and gain a competitive edge. My AI solutions work around the clock, handling repetitive tasks and processes so you can focus on what matters most. By automating what can be automated, my clients save time, reduce costs, and stay ahead of competitors who still rely on manual work. Whether you're scaling your business or streamlining personal workflows, I deliver AI automation that works for you.
